description: Homework quiz for Session 5: Applying logical operators in real scenarios

questions.question: You can download a game if you are over 13 OR have parental permission. Age=10, permission=True. Can you download?
questions.explanation: OR means at least one condition must be True. Permission is True, so allowed.

questions.question: A door unlocks if you have a keycard AND know the PIN. You have the card but forgot the PIN. Does it open?
questions.explanation: AND requires both. Missing PIN means one condition is False, so result is False.

questions.question: You want to check if a user is NOT a guest. Which is correct?
questions.explanation: Both != and not == mean 'not equal'. They are interchangeable here.

questions.question: What is not (5 > 3)?
questions.explanation: 5 > 3 is True. not True is False.

questions.question: You qualify for a discount if you are a student OR age < 18. Age=20, student=False. Do you get a discount?
questions.explanation: Both conditions are False (not a student, not under 18). OR needs at least one True.

questions.question: What is (age >= 13) and (age <= 19) checking for?
options: If age is a teenager (13-19 inclusive)
questions.explanation: >=13 and <=19 defines the teenage range, including both 13 and 19.

questions.question: What is the result of: not (True or False)?
questions.explanation: Inside ( ): True or False = True. Then not True = False.

questions.question: A smart bulb turns on if it's dark AND motion is detected, OR if override switch is ON. Dark=True, motion=False, override=True. Does it turn on?
questions.explanation: OR with override=True makes the whole condition True, regardless of dark and motion.

questions.question: Which combination makes (A and B) evaluate to True?
questions.explanation: AND is only True when both A and B are True.

questions.question:
You wrote: if age > 12 and < 18: print('Teen')
It fails. Why?
options: Cannot combine > and < in one statement like that
questions.explanation: You must repeat the variable: age > 12 and age < 18.

title: Session 5: Logical Operators - Homework Quiz
